class_notes:
(Same as MUS 303 1)
(Black Music Studies will engage historical and contemporary black aesthetic traditions while considering the social construction of race, class, gender, and sexuality. Students will engage literature in Black Studies, feminisms, visual and sound studies toward a critique of cultural production.)
course_description: This course considers the idea of Black Music. What is it? What does it sound like?  Who created it? These musical questions are set in the context of an equally complicated web of ideas about race and the relationship between racial expectation and black music/cultural production.
